alert.note: Alert for Benton (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 10:55PM PST until January 04 at 5:24PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Marys River near Philomath affecting Benton County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marys River near Philomath. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Above 20.8 feet, expect widespread flooding in Philomath, especially on the south side in the vicinity of Chapel drive and Grange Hall Road, in central Benton County, and portions of Corvallis. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM PST Monday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 PM PST Monday was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 18.0 feet late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon by 1000 AM PST.
